title: Sarong, "Sea Weed", 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Batik sarong in brown, pink, and dark blue. Dark blue seaweed pattern placed freely over the pink-brown ground in the body or 'badan' of the piece. The head or 'kepala' (broad band with different coloring and pattern than remainder) shows dark ground with floral pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, "Sea Weed", 19th century.Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. 1961-115-29.
